column3: 863) in cash ready to swap for the documents. Top NATO Scientist With Security Clearance Busted Spying for ChinaThe Italian
column4: who was the captain of a navy frigate
column5: was taken into custody on charges of espionage and endangering state security.  The Russian
column7: was released to the Russian embassy in Rome and will be expelled from the country.  On Tuesday
column8: Italy’s foreign ministry summoned Russian ambassador Sergey Razov to get to the bottom of the matter.  The foreign minister’s office later announced that Italy had expelled two Russian diplomats tied to the arrest
column9: but did not elaborate who the second Russian was or what role he or she may have played.  The Russian embassy in Rome confirmed the events and released a short statement
column10: saying it was “verifying” details
column11: and hoped the inconvenient series of events would not compromise relations between the two nations.  “For now
column12: we consider it inappropriate to comment on what happened
column14: we hope that what happened is not reflected on the bilateral relationship between Russia and Italy. ”Russian president Vladimir Putin’s obsession with the destruction of NATO
column15: which was to a large extent backed by former President Donald Trump
column16: is not yet confirmed as the motive behind the sale of these documents.  There are six NATO bases in Italy
column17: all joint operations with the U. S.  and Italian military.  It is yet unknown which of those bases the alleged Italian spy worked on. NATO officials did not immediately return requests for information
column18: but this is the second event involving classified NATO documents in recent weeks.  In mid March
column19: an Estonian researcher with NATO clearance was arrested for spying for China.  Top NATO Scientist With Security Clearance Busted Spying for ChinaThe two had been under surveillance for more than two months in an investigation led by Italian secret service chief Mario Parente.  They were arrested as they passed the dossier for a wad of cash

column1: 2021-03-30 19:08:07#tech#CD Projekt has 'decided to reconsider' Cyberpunk 2077’s multiplayer#https://www.pcgamer.com/cd-projekt-has-decided-to-reconsider-cyberpunk-2077s-multiplayer/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/yx4SMhV5qJ4yPpfo3Pewvm-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#"In a strategy update video released today
column2: CD Projekt said that it has ""decided to reconsider"" its plans for Cyberpunk 2077 multiplayer.  As part of a broader move toward a more ""agile"" approach to development
column3: the studio is shifting its focus to bringing online elements to all its games ""where they make sense. ""The exact nature of Cyberpunk 2077 multiplayer has never really been nailed down
column4: but it was expected to be something big
column5: possibly akin to GTA Online.  In a November 2020 earnings call transcribed by Seeking Alpha
column6: CD Projekt joint CEO Adam Kiciński described it as ""a separate dedicated production"" that developers consider  ""a standalone product. ""Obviously
column7: it's not entirely standalone as it comes from the universe of Cyberpunk and is very much related to the concept of single player Cyberpunk we—I came up with
column8: he said at the time.  ""But from our perspective
column9: it's—is another independent production and independent team of people works on it. ""Now
column10: however
column11: it sounds like that plan has been scrapped.  After discussing how CD Projekt plans to change its approach to game development going forward
column12: Kiciński said the studio has decided to take a different approach to multiplayer—and not just in Cyberpunk. ""Previously we hinted that our next triple-A would be a multiplayer Cyberpunk game
column13: but we have decided to reconsider this plan
column14: Kiciński says in the video.  ""Given our new
column16: instead of primarily focusing on one big online experience or game
column17: we are focusing on bringing online into all of our franchises one day.  We are building an online technology that can be seamlessly integrated into development of our future games. ""Details are naturally short at this point
column18: but Kiciński said that GOG Galaxy
column20: will play a central role in the effort to ""grow a global community of gamers. "" At the same time
column21: he emphasized that this new approach should not be taken as a sign that CD Projekt is moving away from the style of games it's known for. ""CD Projekt Red makes singleplayer
column23: triple-A RPGs.  That is not changing
column24: he said.  ""What is changing is our long-term approach to online.  By this
column25: we mean ensuring we are properly prepared to implement online elements in our games where they make sense.  We don't have to go overboard
column26: or lose our singleplayer DNA.  We want to take thoughtful steps to build robust online capabilities. ""Presumably as part of that process
column27: CD Projekt also announced today that it has acquired Digital Scapes
column28: a Canadian studio that specializes in multiplayer game development.  Digital Scapes
column29: which has been renamed to CD Projekt Red Vancouver
column30: has been working on Cyberpunk 2077 since October 2018
column31: and while there's no information yet on how the studio's role will change now that it's officially part of the family
column32: it would seem to be a natural fit for CD Projekt's expanded multiplayer plans. CD Projekt's strategy update video touches a number of other topics
column33: including greater integration of development teams
column36: an increased focus on the health and wellbeing of the development team.  It's also expanding development capacity ""to enable parallel triple-a game development
column37: which could be a hint of good news for Witcher fans crossing their fingers for a new game. I've reached out to CD Projekt to inquire about its revised plans for Cyberpunk 2077 multiplayer
column38: and will update if I receive a reply. "#https://www.pcgamer.com/cd-projekt-has-decided-to-reconsider-cyberpunk-2077s-multiplayer/#yQyCz8hko

column1: 2021-03-30 16:16:13#tech#Nvidia's latest graphics cards get a free speed boost today... in exactly 17 games#https://www.pcgamer.com/nvidias-latest-graphics-cards-get-a-free-speed-boost-today-in-exactly-17-games/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/BrTVvJfkmEWaMWa7kfoBQa-1200-80.jpg#en#0.7184#www.pcgamer.com#Nvidia has just flicked the big virtual switch that has turned on Resizable BAR support for all of its RTX 30-Series GPUs—gifting anyone with an Ampere GPU a free speed boost.  It's courtesy of an optional feature of PCI Express that allows the CPU to more efficiently access your graphics card's VRAM. The feature was originally only turned on for the RTX 3060 and the growing range of laptops that use its Ampere graphics technology
column2: but now all of Nvidia's Ampere cards get the same level of PCIe love.  Nvidia has done its bit
column3: but there are plenty of other elements that need to be bang up-to-date for Resizable BAR to work
column4: including a compatible CPU and motherboard.  You'll also need to update your motherboard BIOS as well as flash your graphics card's VBIOS to get it working.  Finally
column5: you'll need to update to the very latest Game Ready Driver driver. Got all that? Then you're in a great position to claim all your free extra frames.  And there are some decent improvements to be had
column6: with F1 2020 pulling out ahead with an 11. 9 percent improvement and Cyberpunk 2077 bring up the rear at a 5. 9 percent boost.  Hardly earth-shattering improvements
column8: it's free
column9: so you may as well. #https://www.pcgamer.com/nvidias-latest-graphics-cards-get-a-free-speed-boost-today-in-exactly-17-games/#uPTbyfp8d

column2: Rivian Sued In Illinois Over Direct Sales Model#https://finance.yahoo.com/news/lucid-rivian-sued-illinois-over-080149284.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/w4KrdzB9aqBWDDdviOO82A--~B/aD00MDA7dz02MDA7YXBwaWQ9eXRhY2h5b24-/https://media.zenfs.com/en/Benzinga/d740ab4abcc49b499ff4fce153773b3e#en#0.0#finance.yahoo.com#A lawsuit has been filed against electric vehicle startups Rivian Automotive and Lucid Motors in Illinois for selling vehicles directly to consumers in the state.  What Happened: The lawsuit was filed by the Illinois Automobile Dealers Association
column3: the Chicago Automobile Trade Association
column4: and other plaintiffs including individual franchised auto dealers in the state.  The plaintiffs allege that Amazon. com Inc.  (NASDAQ: AMZN)-backed electric truck startup Rivian
column5: California-based EV startup Lucid Motors and the state of Illinois are violating state laws that require new vehicles to be sold through franchised dealers.  It accuses the Secretary of State’s office of “turning a blind eye to Rivian’s unlicensed sales operations” in violation of state law.  Lucid Motors plans to go public via a SPAC merger with blank-check company Churchill Capital Corp.  IV (NYSE: CCIV).  The company is on track to deliver its Air luxury vehicle later this year and is focusing on a direct-to-consumer model by opening new showrooms called “Lucid Studios. ” Lucid plans to open a showroom in Oak Brook
column7: in the second quarter of 2021.  Rivian has said it plans to begin delivering its R1T electric pickup truck in June and its R1S electric SUV in August this year.  The company manufactures its flagship EVs at its plant in Normal
column8: Illinois.  The company is constructing a showroom in Chicago.  See Also: Lucid Says The High-End Version Of Its Air Sedan Is Already Sold Out Why It Matters: Illinois auto dealers have previously too expressed their concern over direct sales and challenged Tesla Inc.  (NASDAQ: TSLA) for its direct-to-consumer sales model.  In May 2019
column9: the auto dealers
column10: the Secretary of State and Tesla entered into an administrative consent order agreeing that Tesla could have no more than 13 dealer licenses in Illinois
column12: other automakers are increasingly following Tesla’s lead by adopting the direct sales model.  It was reported in February that Lordstown Motors Corp.  (NASDAQ: RIDE) is looking to sell its trucks directly to customers in Ohio.  Ohio allowed Tesla to make direct sales to its customers in 2014.  At the time
column13: the Ohio dealer’s association had tried to block the Elon Musk-led company from selling directly.  Tesla has a similar arrangement in Michigan as well.  See also: How to Buy Lucid Motors IPO Stock Price Action: Churchill Capital shares closed about 7. 3% lower on Monday at $21. 35.  Read Next: Tesla Rival Rivian To Install Over 3
column15: 000 Open To Public By 2023 Click here to check out Benzinga’s EV Hub for the latest electric vehicles news. 2021-03-30 20:19:16#tech#Kingdom Hearts PC save files are tucked inside cute PNG images
column2: because of course they are#https://www.pcgamer.com/kingdom-hearts-pc-save-files-are-tucked-inside-cute-png-images-because-of-course-they-are/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/XWS8doThLS4C3Mj2u6kyaR-1200-80.jpg#en#0.7351#www.pcgamer.com#Kingdom Hearts is renowned for its endearing but needlessly complex story
column3: and apparently its eccentricities don’t stop there
column4: extending even into its software design.  As discovered by Reddit user PerhapsUnexpected
column5: it appears that save files in Kingdom Hearts 2 Final Mix are stored inside a single PNG image.  Seriously!The internet sleuths found the strange 7MB image while digging through the files of the recently released Kingdom Hearts HD 1. 5+2. 5 ReMIX PC port.  They were probably expecting to find a typical save file format like a . txt
column6: but all they could find were two PNG images—one with Mickey Mouse ears called System Data and another with Sora's face called Save Data.  Confused
column7: they tried opening the Sora image with a hex editor and found what appears to be their save data embedded inside the PNG's metadata.  Watch the discovery recorded by Perhaps below. #https://www.pcgamer.com/kingdom-hearts-pc-save-files-are-tucked-inside-cute-png-images-because-of-course-they-are/#lLp36K6fY

column1: 2021-03-30 15:55:20#tech#Ninja Gaiden Black isn't being remastered because the code is in 'pieces'#https://www.pcgamer.com/ninja-gaiden-black-isnt-being-remastered-because-the-code-was-lost/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/8gmpQEPduEJkXRC8c7gB3Y-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0#www.pcgamer.com#"The Ninja Gaiden series is hitting PC for the first time this June with the Ninja Gaiden: Master Collection
column2: containing Ninja Gaiden Sigma
column3: Ninja Gaiden Sigma 2
column4: and Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor's Edge.  But Ninja Gaiden Black
column5: regarded by many as the best in the series
column6: is a notable absence. In an interview with Polygon
column7: producer Fumihiko Yasuda revealed that one of the reasons Ninja Gaiden Black isn't anywhere to be seen is because a lot of the earlier Ninja Gaiden games weren't preserved
column8: and have since been lost to the ether. ""The data we have left from Ninja Gaiden Black and Ninja Gaiden 2 are in various pieces to the point that we were unable to salvage them
column9: Yasuda said.  ""However
column10: when we worked on Sigma and Sigma 2
column11: we went and collected as much of that data as possible and organised it.  And since we could utilise this data
column12: that's why we chose the Sigma games. ""Yasuda also essentially confirmed that the remastered Sigma 2 will stick with its purple smoke 'blood' instead of returning to the original Ninja Gaiden 2's anarchic limbs-a-flyin' bloodfest
column13: saying ""the content will be similar to the original Sigma
column15: and Ninja Gaiden 3: Razor’s Edge games. ""The Ninja Gaiden: Master Collection hits Steam on June 10.  The collection will run at 60 fps and in 4K on PC
column16: but sadly will see the removal of online mode almost entirely.  Tag Missions are returning
column17: but in a single-player format with ""some of the unreasonably difficult parts"" adjusted to compensate. "#https://www.pcgamer.com/ninja-gaiden-black-isnt-being-remastered-because-the-code-was-lost/#IQTi7bqMf

column1: 2021-03-30 23:11:55#tech#Despite being banned
column2: Disco Elysium: The Final Cut is still available in Australia on PC#https://www.pcgamer.com/despite-being-banned-disco-elysium-the-final-cut-is-still-available-in-australia-on-pc/#https://cdn.mos.cms.futurecdn.net/htMnxRNrJVTpSFSbvWWYV6-1200-80.jpg#en#0.0976#www.pcgamer.com#"When originally released in 2019
column3: Disco Elysium was only available online and so wasn't submitted to Australia's Classification Board—a government body responsible for the regulation of movies
column4: publications
column5: and games—for review.  Disco Elysium's expanded Final Cut edition
column7: was planned to have a physical release and so had to go before the board
column8: where it was refused classification.  Though Disco Elysium's portrayal of drug addiction is hardly a glowing advertisement
column9: taking speed does give a +1 to your Motorics and Psyche stats.  According to the Guidelines for the Classification of Computer Games ""illicit or proscribed drug use related to incentives or rewards"" means a game is automatically refused classification and selling
column10: distributing
column13: or importing it into Australia becomes a criminal offense. Previously
column14: games that fell afoul of the same rule like Wasteland 3 and Fallout 3 were altered to either remove similar interactions or more blatantly fictionalize their drugs.  Disco Elysium was not
column15: which is why it's a surprise to see Disco Elysium: The Final Cut on sale in Australia on Steam
column17: and the Epic Games Store—though it hasn't shown up on the PlayStation Store here and presumably won't.  Anyone who already owns Disco Elysium receives the Final Cut as a free update
column18: and we were expecting that to sneak past (it has
column21: and was immediately abused by a fully voiced Cuno).  But we weren't expecting it to remain on sale
column22: given that Hotline Miami 2 for instance
column23: still can't be purchased here. However
column24: other games that were refused classification in Australia like Katana Zero
column26: and Super Blood Hockey have remained available on multiple digital storefronts.  Perhaps Disco Elysium will join them in quietly persisting
column27: or perhaps it'll disappear.  Probably best to grab a copy now

column1: 2021-03-30 09:00:48#science#The enduring questions about Mars are starting to be answered#https://news.yahoo.com/enduring-questions-mars-starting-answered-090048732.html#https://s.yimg.com/uu/api/res/1.2/Lzcuf7jwYvzuiSywHch_Nw--~B/aD03MjA7dz0xMjgwO2FwcGlkPXl0YWNoeW9u/https://media.zenfs.com/en/axios_articles_623/7b0e2ce42a3a6f3c986bbc2f60f3b2f0#en#0.0#news.yahoo.com#"The rovers and orbiters studying Mars are being tasked with answering the persistent questions that remain about the Red Planet
column2: decades after NASA sent its first missions to the world. Why it matters: New spacecraft recently sent to Mars will help NASA and other space agencies fill in gaps in knowledge
column3: moving them ever-closer to finding out whether the world once played host to life. Get market news worthy of your time with Axios Markets.  Subscribe for free. But answering questions about Mars' past and its potential for life will likely take more spacecraft
column4: and possibly even human missions to solve. Driving the news: A study published this month suggests much of Mars' water may have been absorbed into the ground
column5: not lost to space
column6: as scientists have thought for decades. Thanks to this new study
column7: scientists have been able to start to square the planet's geology with what they know of how its atmosphere was lost
column8: painting a clearer picture of why the world is now the barren one we see today. Yes
column9: but: Not all questions about Mars can be quickly answered with current data. Perhaps the most pressing question has stood for centuries: Has life ever existed on the Red Planet? NASA is just scratching the surface of answering that question using its Perseverance rover — the first mission dedicated to hunting for past Martian life — which made it to Mars in February.  Even that rover likely won't be able to find signs of life on its own
column10: however.  Perseverance is expected to cache samples for a return to Earth on a future mission that will allow scientists to use high-powered tools to analyze the samples. The big questions: Although scientists know Mars was once habitable — at least for microbial life — it's still not clear that the environment could have supported diverse and abundant life as we see on Earth.  While the planet did have lakes and rivers
column11: researchers don't know exactly how warm the planet was. ""There are a lot of basic things we still don't know
column12: like how warm or how wet was ancient Mars? Was it a cold
column13: icy barren world or was it this warmer
column14: wetter . . .  warm desert planet?"" Purdue University planetary scientist Briony Horgan told me. Rovers on the planet have also found the world is scattered with layered rocks
column15: but no one is quite sure how they formed.  Scientists' best guess at the moment is these layers formed through erosion
column17: water and ice.  But we don't see rock layers like this on Earth because they're destroyed by plate tectonics
column19: Horgan added.  The intrigue: Sending rovers and landers to Mars has actually complicated scientists' understanding of the Red Planet. ""When you only have one data point
column20: it's easy to make a model that fits that one data point
column21: but when you have 50 data points
column22: it's a lot harder to find the right model to fit those data
column23: NASA Mars researcher Abigail Fraeman told me. What's next: Human missions to the Red Planet could one day help resolve these mismatches between data beamed back from spacecraft in orbit and rover-collected data from the ground.  Having people on Mars would allow scientists to easily move to other parts of the planet to search for interesting rocks without the planning and guesswork that goes into a rover's roadmap
column24: experts say. More from Axios: Sign up to get the latest market trends with Axios Markets.  Subscribe for free"#https://news.yahoo.com/enduring-questions-mars-starting-answered-090048732.html#Rj7x2AMAC
